record.source: Chrysanthos S. Chrysanthou, Herodian and Cassius Dio: A Study of Herodian’s Compositional Devices, 2020.
record.comment_on_chronology: The author mentions that it was composed somewhere in the middle of the 3rd century. Other scholars have proposed either the beginning or the end of the 3rd Century AD.

record.author: Herodotus

record.source: SANSONE, D. (1985). The Date of Herodotus’ Publication. Illinois Classical Studies, 10(1), 1–9
record.comment_on_chronology: Some authord argue for a later date, around 414 BC.

record.author: Philo Judaeus
record.printed_edition: Philo Judaeus. Cohn, Leonard, editor. Opera que supersunt, Volume 1. Berlin: Reimer, 1896.
record.source: IEHOFF, M. R. (2018). Philo of Alexandria: An Intellectual Biography. Yale University Press
record.comment_on_chronology: Niehoff considers that Philo wrote his philosophical, legal and historical works during his years in Rome. His book is the first systematic attempt to date Philo's works.

record.source: Wikipedia
record.comment_on_chronology: The letter has an impersonal character, implying that Paul did not have personal knoledge of the intended recipients of the letter. It most probably was written during his first imprisonment in Rome. Some scholars suggest a date of between 70 AD and 80 AD.

record.comment_on_chronology: The author cites that "Alcinous fits most comfortably into a period bounded by the writings of Plutarch on the one hand, and Galen and Alexander of Aphrodisias on the other, with Apuleius, Albinus, Atticus, Numenius, the Peripatetic Aspasius, ... and Maximus of Tyre as approximate contemporaries." (p. xiii)
